meanings.definition: To coat or cover with a pattern resembling marble.
meanings.sent1: She decided to marbleise her tabletop to give it a fancy look.
meanings.sent2: The artist used special paint to marbleise the walls of the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: The chef attempted to marbleise the cake, but it ended up looking more like a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The fog seemed to marbleise the landscape, creating a dreamy effect.
meanings.sent5: The decorator's skillful hands were able to marbleise the plain vase into a work of art.

meanings.definition: To become like marble in appearance or texture.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the statue started to marbleise due to weathering.
meanings.sent2: The old building's facade began to marbleise, giving it a majestic look.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream melted in such a way that it seemed to marbleise into a creamy swirl.
meanings.sent4: Her skin, after applying the lotion, appeared to marbleise, becoming smooth and radiant.
meanings.sent5: The rock in the river had marbleised over the years, becoming polished and shiny.
